class.name: FtpDirEntry
class.javadoc:
A {@code FtpDirEntry} is a class agregating all the information that the FTP client can gather from the server by doing a {@code LST} (or {@code NLST}) command and parsing the output. It will typically contain the name, type, size, last modification time, owner and group of the file, although some of these could be unavailable due to specific FTP server limitations.
sun.net.ftp.FtpDirParser
1.7

Creates an FtpDirEntry instance with only the name being set.
name The name of the file

Returns the name of the remote file.
a {@code String} containing the name of the remote file.

Returns the user name of the owner of the file as returned by the FTP server, if provided. This could be a name or a user id (number).
a {@code String} containing the user name or{@code null} if that information is not available.

Sets the user name of the owner of the file. Intended mostly to be used from inside a {@link java.net.FtpDirParser} implementation.
user The user name of the owner of the file, or {@code null}if that information is not available.
this FtpDirEntry

Returns the group name of the file as returned by the FTP server, if provided. This could be a name or a group id (number).
a {@code String} containing the group name or{@code null} if that information is not available.

Sets the name of the group to which the file belong. Intended mostly to be used from inside a {@link java.net.FtpDirParser} implementation.
group The name of the group to which the file belong, or {@code null}if that information is not available.
this FtpDirEntry

Returns the size of the remote file as it was returned by the FTP server, if provided.
the size of the file or -1 if that information is not available.

Sets the size of that file. Intended mostly to be used from inside an{@link java.net.FtpDirParser} implementation.
size The size, in bytes, of that file. or -1 if unknown.
this FtpDirEntry

Returns the type of the remote file as it was returned by the FTP server, if provided. It returns a FtpDirEntry.Type enum and the values can be: - FtpDirEntry.Type.FILE for a normal file - FtpDirEntry.Type.DIR for a directory - FtpDirEntry.Type.LINK for a symbolic link
a {@code FtpDirEntry.Type} describing the type of the file or {@code null} if that information is not available.

Sets the type of the file. Intended mostly to be used from inside an{@link java.net.FtpDirParser} implementation.
type the type of this file or {@code null} if that information is not available.
this FtpDirEntry

Returns the last modification time of the remote file as it was returned by the FTP server, if provided, {@code null} otherwise. a Date representing the last time the file was modified on the server, or {@code null} if that information is not available.

Sets the last modification time of the file. Intended mostly to be used from inside an {@link java.net.FtpDirParser} implementation.
lastModified The Date representing the last modification time, or{@code null} if that information is not available.
this FtpDirEntry

Returns whether read access is granted for a specific permission.
p the Permission (user, group, others) to check.
{@code true} if read access is granted.

Returns whether write access is granted for a specific permission.
p the Permission (user, group, others) to check.
{@code true} if write access is granted.

Returns whether execute access is granted for a specific permission.
p the Permission (user, group, others) to check.
{@code true} if execute access is granted.

Sets the permissions for that file. Intended mostly to be used from inside an {@link java.net.FtpDirParser} implementation. The permissions array is a 3x3 {@code boolean} array, the first index being the User, group or owner (0, 1 and 2 respectively) while the second index is read, write or execute (0, 1 and 2 respectively again).

E.G.: {@code permissions[1][2]} is the group/execute permission.

permissions a 3x3 {@code boolean} array this {@code FtpDirEntry}

Adds a 'fact', as defined in RFC 3659, to the list of facts of this file. Intended mostly to be used from inside a {@link java.net.FtpDirParser}implementation.
fact the name of the fact (e.g. "Media-Type"). It is not case-sensitive.
value the value associated with this fact.
this {@code FtpDirEntry}

Returns the requested 'fact', as defined in RFC 3659, if available.
fact The name of the fact e.g. "Media-Type"). It is not case sensitive.
The value of the fact or, {@code null} if that fact wasn't provided by the server.

Returns the creation time of the file, when provided by the server.
The Date representing the creation time, or {@code null}if the server didn't provide that information.

Sets the creation time for that file. Intended mostly to be used from inside a {@link java.net.FtpDirParser} implementation.
created the Date representing the creation time for that file, or{@code null} if that information is not available.
this FtpDirEntry

Returns a string representation of the object. The {@code toString} method for class {@code FtpDirEntry}returns a string consisting of the name of the file, followed by its type between brackets, followed by the user and group between parenthesis, then size between '{', and, finally, the lastModified of last modification if it's available.
a string representation of the object.
